result.execSummary:
The defendant Toni L. Harmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The defendant's bond shall be applied towards the costs and the balance shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning May 15, 2017.

The jail sentence shall begin no later than June 20, 2017.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail time may be broken up into two blocks of days as long as the second and final block of days is started by June 20, 2017.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Ignition Interlock Device Court Order

Defendant Toni L. Harmon in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to Counts 2 and 3.    Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3.  The remaining counts are dismissed and read in.  Court orders on Count 2 - 30 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than June 20, 2017; court costs and DNA sample.  Count 3 - court orders $1,570.00 fine; 30 days county jail with huber and good time consecutive to count 2; 13 month driver's license revocation with credit for administrative suspension; $41.00 blood draw; AODA and comply with driver safety plan; IID for one year.  Court orders 5 days sentence credit.  Court orders that $750.00 of the cash bond be sent to Chippewa County for the warrant and the balance to be applied towards the unpaid court obligations.  The remaining court obligations are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning May 15, 2017.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on August 25, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

ADR began at 1:33 p.m.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Toni L. Harmon appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Court orders bond as requested by the Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is initial appearance for August 25, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
